info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 01 at 12:06AM MDT until August 01 at 1:45AM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 AM MDT EARLY THIS MORNING FOR SOUTHERN IRON AND EAST CENTRAL WASHINGTON COUNTIES... At 1206 AM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the Kolob section of Zion National Park. Between 0.75 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks, streams, and normally dry washes. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Kolob section of Zion National Park including La Verkin Creek, Taylor Creek, and Kolob Canyon. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
